sentence.Network_en: New guns firing high explosive shells were incorporated into the battlefield.
sentence.Network_cn: 发射高爆弹的新型大炮在战场上得到了使用。

sentence.Network_en: I shall conceal myself at a safe distance from the battlefield.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会躲在一个远离战场的安全地带。

sentence.Network_en: The two opposing armies faced each other across the battlefield.
sentence.Network_cn: 敌对两军在战场上严阵对峙。

entry.def: A battlefield is a place where a battle is fought.

entry.tran: 争论的主题；斗争的领域
entry.def: You can refer to an issue or field of activity over which people disagree or compete as a battlefield .

example.tran: 家庭生活内部争论的主题

means.word_mean: 1. a region where a battle is being (or has been) fought;

sentences.sentence: "they made a tour of Civil War battlefields"

auth_sentence.content: He said cyberspace shouldn't become a new battlefield.

auth_sentence.content: Such military virtues as blind obedience and battlefield valor.

Sentence.sentence: Mounted cavalry (骑兵) replaced the chariot (二轮战车) on the battlefield around 1000 BC.

sentences.en: Her son died on the battlefield.
He showed valour and skill on the battlefield.
sentences.cn: 他在战场上显得骁勇善战。

sentences.en: Both my travelling companion and I wanted to go to Waterloo—that historic battlefield.
sentences.cn: 我的旅游伙伴和我都想去滑铁卢——那个历史上著名的战场。
